title: Requires adequate training in the Heimlich maneuver and cardiopulmonary resuscitation for new certification as a school teacher
summary: Requires adequate training in the Heimlich maneuver and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR), by an institution or provider approved by the state education department, as a condition of certification as a school teacher.

       AN ACT to amend the education law, in  relation  to  requiring  adequate
         training  in  the  Heimlich maneuver and cardiopulmonary resuscitation
         (CPR) for new certification as a school teacher

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Section  3004 of the education law is amended by adding a
    2  new subdivision 7 to read as follows:
    3    7. NOTWITHSTANDING ANY OTHER PROVISION OF LAW, THE COMMISSIONER  SHALL
    4  PRESCRIBE  REGULATIONS  REQUIRING THAT ALL PERSONS APPLYING, ON OR AFTER
    5  JULY FIRST, TWO THOUSAND ELEVEN, FOR A CERTIFICATE OR LICENSE  TO  BE  A
    6  TEACHER  SHALL,  IN ADDITION TO ALL THE OTHER CERTIFICATION OR LICENSURE
    7  REQUIREMENTS, HAVE COMPLETED ADEQUATE TRAINING IN THE HEIMLICH  MANEUVER
    8  AND  CARDIOPULMONARY RESUSCITATION (CPR). THE TRAINING SHALL BE OBTAINED
    9  FROM AN INSTITUTION OR PROVIDER WHICH HAS BEEN APPROVED BY  THE  DEPART-
   10  MENT TO PROVIDE SUCH TRAINING.  EACH APPLICANT SHALL PROVIDE THE DEPART-
   11  MENT  WITH  DOCUMENTATION  SHOWING  THAT  HE  OR  SHE  HAS COMPLETED THE
   12  REQUIRED TRAINING.
   13    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2670

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the education law, in relation to requiring adequate
training in the
Heimlich maneuver and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) for
new certification as a school teacher

PURPOSE/SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
This bill would amend Section 3004 of
the education law by adding a new subdivision 7 requiring certification
as a school teacher to include training in the Heimlich maneuver and
cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR). As of July 1, 2005 anyone
applying for teacher certification will need to have completed
training in the Heimlich maneuver and CPR.

EXISTING LAW:
None.

JUSTIFICATION:
This bill would provide for the safety
of the students
within the state by requiring that all teachers applying for teacher
certification, as of July 1, 2005, be certified in the Heimlich
maneuver and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR). These educators are
in constant contact with children and may be needed to provide this
emergency care.
Their training in the Heimlich maneuver and cardiopulmonary
resuscitation could save a child's life.

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
To be determined.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect immediately.
